body.p: To Thos E. Bramlette Esqr -- Gov. of Kentucky

Your petitioners represent that at the June term of the Henderson Circuit Court one Arthur Payne was indicted tried and convicted of larceny and sentenced to four years confinement to the Penitentiary of the State

The case we think presents many features upon which we are justified in basing an application for clemency and pardon of your Excellency -- Arthur Payne is a child in years and Size, is English by birth -- came to this country when about seven years old and is now about fifteen -- has been an orphan for several years and for that length of time friendless and homeless -- Acting under the suggestion and influence of an older person he took away the horse and carried him to the State of Ind where he we was arrested -- We believe that Your Excellency will do right in extending to the unfortunate boy the benefit of executive clemency and we confidently that you will do so -- We append a copy of the verdict of the jury finding him guilty July 11th 1865

Malcolm Yeaman
Jno Barret County atty.
P. G. Rives. D. Clerk
C Eaves
Adam Rankin Clerk H. Cir Ct.
S B Vance
J H Powell
W. P Fowler (Judge)
L W Powell
James B. Lyne
John Young Brown
Jno T Brunch
A. H. Lockett
Rot Glass
(over)
Harvey Yeaman

(Jesse Robertson

James Beatty

J, H, Craddock

James. B. Evans
James Marion
W A Landers
J. F. Jones
H. L. Cheany } Jury
we of the Jury find the defendant guilty, and fix the penalty of his crime at four years confinement in the Penitentiary But recommend him to Executive Clemency on account of his youth
The above is a true copy of the verdict of the Jury in the case of the Commonth of Kentucky vs Arthur Payne alias Arthur Hunter in the Henderson Circuit Court
Attest: Adam Rankin C H C C

Henderson Cir Ct
vs
Arthur Payne
Pardoned
19 July 1865
